info.name: Naval Warfare
info.attribution:
Room layout and design by LawDawg and released to the public domain by CC0.

Background water image by Michelle_Raponi is available under the Pixabay license at https://pixabay.com/photos/water-sea-caribbean-background-1330252/.

Library image generated using the Midjourney artificial intelligence image generator, https://www.midjourney.com/home/, using the following prompt: "world war 2 battleship on fire, oil on canvas "
info.description: Find and sink your opponent's ships before they sink yours.
info.ruleText:
Sit in a seat. Place your ships onto the area of the colored grid that corresponds to your seat color and map border color.  Click on the ship to rotate it. Place the meeple on one of the tan land spaces in the same section.

One player begins by naming a grid space (for example H6) that corresponds to the other player's color. The other player verifies whether the shot was a hit or miss.  Both players mark hits with red pegs. If you miss, you should mark it on your grid with a white peg so you do not target that grid space again. Players take turns calling out shots.

Once all the spaces (they range from 2-5) of a ship have been hit, the player must tell the opponent which ship was sunk.  Once all ships have been sunk, target the tan land spaces until you hit the one with the opponent's meeple. That player wins.

Variation:
 - Call out shots in groups of 5. After the group is completed, the opponent tells you which hits were made.
 - For each ship that is sunk in your own fleet, you get one less shot during your turn. So, for example, if three ships are lost, you only fire two shots per round.
